<documents>
<pddl_domain>
;; Enrico Scala (enricos83@gmail.com) and Miquel Ramirez (miquel.ramirez@gmail.com)
(define (domain zenotravel)
        ;(:requirements :typing :fluents)
        (:types
                locatable city - object
                aircraft person - locatable
        )
        (:predicates
                (located ?x - locatable ?c - city)
                (in ?p - person ?a - aircraft)
        )
        (:functions
                (fuel ?a - aircraft)
                (distance ?c1 - city ?c2 - city)
                (slow-burn ?a - aircraft)
                (fast-burn ?a - aircraft)
                (capacity ?a - aircraft)
                (total-fuel-used)
                (onboard ?a - aircraft)
                (zoom-limit ?a - aircraft)

                (n_board ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                (n_debark ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                (n_flyslow ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                (n_flyfast ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                (n_refuel ?a - aircraft)
        )

        (:action board
                :parameters (?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?p ?c)
                        (located ?a ?c))
                :effect (and (not (located ?p ?c))
                        (in ?p ?a)
                        (increase (onboard ?a) 1)
                        (increase (n_board ?p ?a ?c) 1))
        )

        (:action debark
                :parameters (?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                :precondition (and (in ?p ?a)
                        (located ?a ?c))
                :effect (and (not (in ?p ?a))
                        (located ?p ?c)
                        (decrease (onboard ?a) 1)
                        (increase (n_debark ?p ?a ?c) 1))
        )

        (:action flyslow
                :parameters (?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?a ?c1)
                        (>= (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow-burn ?a))))
                :effect (and (not (located ?a ?c1))
                        (located ?a ?c2)
                        (increase
                                (total-fuel-used)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow-burn ?a)))
                        (decrease
                                (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow-burn ?a)))
                        (increase (n_flyslow ?a ?c1 ?c2) 1))
        )

        (:action flyfast
                :parameters (?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?a ?c1)
                        (>= (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast-burn ?a)))
                        (<= (onboard ?a) (zoom-limit ?a)))
                :effect (and (not (located ?a ?c1))
                        (located ?a ?c2)
                        (increase
                                (total-fuel-used)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast-burn ?a)))
                        (decrease
                                (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast-burn ?a)))
                        (increase (n_flyfast ?a ?c1 ?c2) 1))
        )

        (:action refuel
                :parameters (?a - aircraft)
                :precondition (and (> (capacity ?a) (fuel ?a))

                )
                :effect (and (assign (fuel ?a) (capacity ?a))
                        (increase (n_refuel ?a) 1))
        )

)
</pddl_domain>
<pddl_problem>
(define (problem ZTRAVEL-3-10)
(:domain zenotravel)
(:objects
	plane1 - aircraft
	plane2 - aircraft
	plane3 - aircraft
	person1 - person
	person2 - person
	person3 - person
	person4 - person

	person10 - person
	city0 - city
	city1 - city
	city2 - city
	city3 - city
	city4 - city
	city5 - city
	)
(:init
	(located plane1 city4)
	(= (capacity plane1) 2326)
	(= (fuel plane1) 205)
	(= (slow-burn plane1) 1)
	(= (fast-burn plane1) 2)

	(located person1 city1)

	(located person7 city0)

	(located person10 city5)
	(= (distance city0 city0) 0)
	(= (distance city0 city1) 619)
	(= (distance city0 city2) 565)

	(= (distance city0 city4) 596)
	(= (distance city0 city5) 766)
	(= (distance city1 city0) 619)
	(= (distance city1 city1) 0)
	(= (distance city1 city2) 561)
	(= (distance city1 city3) 756)
	(= (distance city1 city4) 760)

	(= (distance city2 city0) 565)

	(= (distance city2 city2) 0)

	(= (distance city2 city5) 639)
	(= (distance city3 city0) 886)

	(= (distance city3 city5) 510)
	(= (distance city4 city0) 596)

	(= (distance city5 city3) 510)
	(= (distance city5 city4) 850)
	(= (distance city5 city5) 0)
	(= (total-fuel-used) 0)
)
(:goal (and
	(located plane1 city4)
	(located person1 city4)
	(located person2 city5)
	(located person3 city4)
	(located person4 city0)
	(located person5 city2)
	(located person6 city3)
	(located person8 city0)
	(located person9 city3)
	(located person10 city4)
	))

(:metric minimize (total-fuel-used))





)
</pddl_problem>
</documents> 

<information>
The user will give as input a natural language constraint that must be translated into PDDL3.0. The translation will be used by a PDDL planner.
</information>

<instructions> 
- Translate the input constraint into correct PDDL3.0.
- The resulting PDDL3.0 constraint must capture the same meaning as the initial input constraint.
- Remember that PDDL3.0 constraints are state-based. They can only refer to existing precates and fluents, thus, not to actions.
- Be sure to include temporal logic like operators in your translation.
- Format your answer such as there is no preambule and such that the PDDL translation is between the tags <pddl> and </pddl>.
</instructions>

<user_input>
Plane1 should never fly to a same city more than 3 times
</user_input>

I need to translate the constraint "Plane1 should never fly to a same city more than 3 times" into PDDL3.0.

Let me first understand what this means:
- This is about plane1 specifically
- It's about flying TO a city (not FROM a city)
- The constraint is that plane1 should never fly to the same city more than 3 times
- This means that for any city, the number of times plane1 flies to that city should be ≤ 3

Looking at the domain, I can see there are two actions that involve flying:
1. `flyslow` - which has a counter `(n_flyslow ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)`
2. `flyfast` - which has a counter `(n_flyfast ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)`

These counters track how many times each action has been performed with specific parameters.

For the constraint "Plane1 should never fly to a same city more than 3 times", I need to consider that plane1 can fly to a city either using flyslow or flyfast. So the total number of times plane1 flies to a city would be the sum of both slow and fast flights to that city.

In PDDL3.0, I need to express this as a state-based constraint using temporal logic. The constraint should be that for any city c, the sum of n_flyslow(plane1, *, c) + n_flyfast(plane1, *, c) should never exceed 3.

However, there's a complication here. The counters n_flyslow and n_flyfast are for specific origin-destination pairs, not just destinations. So n_flyslow(plane1, city1, city2) counts flights from city1 to city2, not just flights to city2.

To count total flights TO a city, I would need to sum over all possible origin cities. 

I'll need to calculate the total flights to each city by summing across all possible origin cities. This means tracking every possible flight path to a specific destination for plane1, ensuring the total never exceeds 3.

The PDDL3.0 constraint will use temporal logic to continuously monitor these flight counts, preventing plane1 from visiting any single city more than three times throughout the entire plan execution. I'll complete the partial thought from the previous thinking by adding "city1)) 3)" and then continue with the next part of the thinking:

I see a complex flight pattern calculation involving plane1 moving between multiple cities. The constraints suggest tracking slow and fast flight combinations between city1 and various other cities, with a limit of 3 total flight movements. The pattern continues systematically across different city pairs, methodically mapping out potential flight routes and their associated movement types.

The calculation now extends to city2, maintaining the same structured approach of tracking both slow and fast flight combinations across different city origins and destinations. Each city pair is systematically evaluated with multiple flight movement possibilities. I see a systematic constraint defining maximum flight frequencies for plane1 across different destination cities. The logic ensures no more than three total flights (combining slow and fast modes) reach any specific destination, creating a flight volume limitation across the entire route network.

<pddl>
(always (and
  (<= (+ (n_flyslow plane1 city0 city0) (n_flyfast plane1 city0 city0) 
         (n_flyslow plane1 city1 city0) (n_flyfast plane1 city1 city0)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city2 city0) (n_flyfast plane1 city2 city0)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city3 city0) (n_flyfast plane1 city3 city0)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city4 city0) (n_flyfast plane1 city4 city0)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city5 city0) (n_flyfast plane1 city5 city0)) 3)
  (<= (+ (n_flyslow plane1 city0 city1) (n_flyfast plane1 city0 city1)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city1 city1) (n_flyfast plane1 city1 city1)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city2 city1) (n_flyfast plane1 city2 city1)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city3 city1) (n_flyfast plane1 city3 city1)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city4 city1) (n_flyfast plane1 city4 city1)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city5 city1) (n_flyfast plane1 city5 city1)) 3)
  (<= (+ (n_flyslow plane1 city0 city2) (n_flyfast plane1 city0 city2)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city1 city2) (n_flyfast plane1 city1 city2)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city2 city2) (n_flyfast plane1 city2 city2)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city3 city2) (n_flyfast plane1 city3 city2)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city4 city2) (n_flyfast plane1 city4 city2)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city5 city2) (n_flyfast plane1 city5 city2)) 3)
  (<= (+ (n_flyslow plane1 city0 city3) (n_flyfast plane1 city0 city3)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city1 city3) (n_flyfast plane1 city1 city3)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city2 city3) (n_flyfast plane1 city2 city3)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city3 city3) (n_flyfast plane1 city3 city3)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city4 city3) (n_flyfast plane1 city4 city3)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city5 city3) (n_flyfast plane1 city5 city3)) 3)
  (<= (+ (n_flyslow plane1 city0 city4) (n_flyfast plane1 city0 city4)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city1 city4) (n_flyfast plane1 city1 city4)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city2 city4) (n_flyfast plane1 city2 city4)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city3 city4) (n_flyfast plane1 city3 city4)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city4 city4) (n_flyfast plane1 city4 city4)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city5 city4) (n_flyfast plane1 city5 city4)) 3)
  (<= (+ (n_flyslow plane1 city0 city5) (n_flyfast plane1 city0 city5)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city1 city5) (n_flyfast plane1 city1 city5)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city2 city5) (n_flyfast plane1 city2 city5)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city3 city5) (n_flyfast plane1 city3 city5)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city4 city5) (n_flyfast plane1 city4 city5)
         (n_flyslow plane1 city5 city5) (n_flyfast plane1 city5 city5)) 3)
))
